  <h2>Context</h2>
  <p>Accurate demand forecasting is essential for ensuring reliable access to contraceptive products, supporting key processes like procurement, inventory management, and distribution. This course aims to equip pharmaceutical officers at healthcare site levels with the knowledge and tools to adopt modern forecasting methods using R and Python.</p>
</div>

<div class="content-section">
  <h2>Target Audience</h2>
  <ul class="styled-list">
    <li>Pharmaceutical officers at healthcare site levels responsible for demand planning</li>
    <li>Anyone interested in forecasting in the context of contraceptive supply chains</li>
  </ul>
</div>

  <div class="outcomes-grid">
    <div>
      <h4>Day 1: Forecasting with R</h4>
      <ul class="styled-list">
        <li>Familiarize with RStudio and R Notebooks.</li>
        <li>Learn data wrangling and feature engineering.</li>
        <li>Understand time series graphics.</li>
        <li>Explore models: sNAIVE, Moving Average, ARIMA, ETS.</li>
        <li>Evaluate model performance.</li>
      </ul>
    </div>
    <div>
      <h4>Day 2: Advanced Forecasting with Python</h4>
      <ul class="styled-list">
        <li>Familiarize with Google Colab and Python Notebooks.</li>
        <li>Implement advanced models: LightGBM, XGBoost, and TimeGPT.</li>
        <li>Evaluate advanced model performance.</li>
        <li>Explore additional learning resources.</li>
      </ul>
    </div>
  </div>
</div>

<div class="content-section">
  <h2>Preparation & Prerequisites</h2>
  <p>No prior experience in time series is required. However, familiarity with the following is recommended:</p>
  <ul class="styled-list">
    <li>Writing R code and using tidyverse packages (dplyr, ggplot2). <a href="https://learnr.numbat.space/" target="_blank">Learn R here</a>.</li>

    <li>Basic statistical concepts such as mean, variance, and regression.</li>

  </ul>
